name: nytimes
text:
At one South Korean hotel, 300 quarantined foreigners are met with loud daily protests from local residents, who want them out.

"This is a hotel that produced a confirmed Covid-19 case. Shut it down immediately!” a large banner outside the hotel reads. https://t.co/CJ00u5xel5

name: nytimes
text: The educator turned anti-racism activist Jane Elliott carried out the ‘Blue Eyes, Brown Eyes’ exercise in her classroom the day after Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated. Now, people are returning to her work. https://t.co/jSZv5FKkGo

name: nytimes
text:
Sparklers were the No. 1 cause of firework-related injuries in 2019, and half of those injuries were in kids under 5.

name: nytimes
text:
In Opinion

"I’ve come to believe that my father was one of the “hidden victims” of the coronavirus pandemic. Doctors suspect that the virus is connected, if indirectly, to a recent surge in Alzheimer’s and dementia deaths," writes Nana Asfour. https://t.co/EWUqqr13H4

name: nytimes
text: If you're planning on a trip to the great outdoors this summer, here are a few apps you that could help you find the best views, trails, takeaway food and plenty of things in between https://t.co/vwXKqZgwLv

name: nytimes
text: Scientists predict this hurricane season will be severe. But countries in the Caribbean, with economies burdened by the pandemic and the devastation of past hurricanes, have not been able to fully prepare. https://t.co/7OUMxflLHB

text: At a hotel in Yongin, South Korea, hundreds of quarantined foreigners are met with noisy daily protests from local residents, who want them out https://t.co/AZBwcxcUiO

text: “Sacrifice, hard work, teamwork, belief in the person on your right and belief in the person on your left.” José Andrés's World Central Kitchen has provided over 2 million meals in Spain and 16 million in the U.S. https://t.co/87goIoMBbX

name: nytimes
text: These 7 history podcasts may fill in some of the gaps left by your school curriculum and help deepen your understanding of what’s happening now. https://t.co/2x6sAeS3LE

name: nytimes
text:
It’s not uncommon for new parents to think of the baby falling down the stairs, choking or drowning in the bathtub. @nytparenting spoke to experts about how to manage the stress and anxiety from these intrusive thoughts.
https://t.co/NTifXPILQW

name: nytimes
text: As games return and dozens of players drop to one knee, leagues that once tried to tiptoe around the issue of whether to stand or kneel during “The Star-Spangled Banner” won't be able to avoid it https://t.co/5MMXtxeyx0
